intro: Uvaria virgata, commonly known as the white uvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Uvaria virgata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
